newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Colombo stocks end little changed but trade brisk.
newsitem.headline: Colombo stocks end little changed but trade brisk.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed barely changed as investors searched for direction after the index reached a resistance level, but turnover was high on local buying, brokers said.
The all share index closed 0.06 points higher at 600.05. National Development Bank rose 5.25 rupees to 200.25, Hotels Corporation 14.50 to 60.
"The index will mark time at a maximum of five percent above or below 600 points, until there is some news to move it," said Ruan Dayananda of Asia Securities.
He said the next direction may come from results for the quarter to September 30 or the budget on November 6.
Turnover was a healthy 74.25 million rupees on 1.7 million shares. The main volumes for the day were local buying of 1.2 million Sampath Bank and foreign buying of 32,000 National Development Bank.
Institutional investors, while waiting for direction, are prepared to hunt for bargains, brokers said.
"We are using the current low prices to take long-term positions," said Derendra Abayaratna of Ceybank Unit Trust.
